articles.author: The Hill
articles.title: Trump campaign targets DeSantis’ votes in Congress on Medicare, Social Security
articles.description: The Trump 2024 campaign took aim Sunday at Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis (R) for his votes on Medicare and Social Security when he was in Congress. “DeSantis is colluding with his globalist handlers to go full Never Trump in order to gaslight the people into thinking that Medicare and Social Security should be ripped away…
articles.content:

articles.author: Newsweek
articles.title: Fox News Host Admits Dominion Lawsuit Not Going Well for His Network
articles.description: Fox News is accused of backing former President Donald Trump's voter fraud claims during the 2020 presidential election while allegedly knowing they were false.
articles.content:
Fox News host Howard Kurtz said on Sunday that Fox News had a "rough" week in the Dominion Voting Systems defamation lawsuit against the network.
Plaintiffs in the lawsuit allege that Fox News, a popular right-wing cable news network, supported forme... [5139 chars]

articles.title: Chris Christie: Trump investigations make GOP primary win ‘uncertain’

articles.author: Cable News Network
articles.title: Brian Kemp says GOP can't be 'distracted' by Trump investigations
articles.description: Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp has a message for his fellow Republicans looking to win back the White House: "We cannot get distracted." His remarks came a day after he offered a thinly veiled dig at Donald Trump, telling GOP donors the party needed to move on from the 2020 presidential election.
articles.content:
CNN —
Georgia Gov. Brian Kemp has a message for his fellow Republicans looking to win back the White House: “We cannot get distracted.”
“We have to tell people, No. 1, what we’re for. No. 2, that we’re going to be focused on the future and what we’re... [2897 chars]

articles.author: CBC.ca
articles.title: More than money at stake as Fox News goes to trial over presidential election coverage
articles.description: The trial will test press freedom and the reputation of conservatives' favourite news source and illuminate the flow of misinformation that helped fuel the Jan. 6, 2021, insurrection at the U.S. Capitol and Donald Trump's re-election bid.
articles.content:
Starting Monday in a courtroom in Delaware, Fox News executives and stars will have to answer for their role in spreading doubt about the 2020 presidential election and creating the gaping wound that remains in America's democracy.
Jurors hearing the... [8487 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Trump campaign reports raising $14.5 million in early 2023
articles.description: Donald Trump's presidential campaign on Saturday reported raising $14.5 million during the first three months of this year, with contributions accelerating sharply after he announced he was about to be criminally indicted. The disclosure to the Federal Election Commission does not cover all of the former president's political fundraising or disclose full details for online donors.
articles.content:

articles.author: The New York Times
articles.title: Trump’s Fund-Raising: From Sluggish to Surging After Indictment
articles.description: While the former president reported a modest haul, he saw a big uptick in donations in the day after he was indicted.
articles.content: Donald J. Trump’s presidential campaign took in $14.4 million in the first three months of 2023, part of an $18.8 million haul across his two campaign committees this quarter — a modest sum that captures only the beginning of a fund-raising bonanza s... [1006 chars]

articles.author: POLITICO
articles.title: Trump turns from past to future at RNC donor retreat
articles.description: The former president traded his election grievance rhetoric for a forward-looking vision for party and country, according to a copy of his Nashville remarks obtained by POLITICO.
articles.content: Declaring that the “old Republican Party is gone, and it is never coming back,” Trump in Nashville urged Republican donors to help put him back in the White House through electoral strategies he once decried, like robust mail-in voting and ballot har... [3634 chars]

articles.author: POLITICO
articles.title: Trump’s fundraising was lagging. Then he said an indictment was imminent.
articles.description: The president’s filing shows he spent much of his money on staff, with some sums going to his businesses.
